snippet: The N.C.A.A. has moved the Final Four to giant football stadiums to sell more tickets, but the intimate feel in which basketball thrives has been lost.
abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column holds that NCAA has moved the Final Four to giant football stadiums to sell more tickets, but the intimate feel in which basketball thrives has been lost; says NCAA is telling everyone that they should embrace this awful trend that has spoiled one of the greatest live sporting events.
lead_paragraph: The N.C.A.A. has moved the Final Four to giant football stadiums to sell more tickets, but the intimate feel in which basketball thrives has been lost.

headline.main: When Money Talks, Game Is Drowned Out at Big Stadiums
headline.print_headline: When Money Talks, Game Is Drowned Out at Big Stadiums
